title: icopress
author: icopress
created_time: April 12, 2023, 10:33:53 PMLast edit: October 02, 2023, 12:18:07 PM by icopress
content: Quote from:   ➥ Buy ' Sell Crypto peer-to-peer [Clearnet] & [Tor Mirror] & [Discussion Thread]  ➥ List of participants [Spreadsheet]AgoraDesk.com is a P2P platform for trading Bitcoin that was created by the team behind LocalMonero.co. In addition to the fact that the platform can function without JavaScript, AgoraDesk is also committed to maintaining simplicity and privacy, so it never requests KYC/AML and never plans to do so.Main Info:➥ No minimum quota/maximum 25 posts➥ Posts after 23:59 UTC Sunday will be counted towards the following week.Code:H/Legendary: (5) - $4/post Rules:➥ Posts in local sections will not be taken into account.➥ Post bursting is not allowed, moreover it is easy to check with ninjastic.space.➥ Posts that do not carry a semantic load or posts whose content is less than 160 characters will not be paid.➥ I reserve the right to change the rules and disqualify any post and any participant for any reason.➥ There are a few more obvious things that I haven't mentioned, but which I'll keep a close eye on.➥ Adding additional lines into your signatures is not allowed.➥ Excluded boards, (WO & Serious, Sig Threads, Press, Politics, Games, Off-topic, Bounty, Mega Threads).Application:➥ Do not send me your application by PM and do not ask why you were not accepted [1], [2].Code:Username:BTC SegWit Address:Quote from: AgoraDesk                                          [1]: When reviewing applications, the campaign manager pays attention to many details, including; how informative and organic your posts are, for what and how often you get merit, do you have a customized trust list and do you use a feedback system. A sig campaign is an “ad” for the customer and a “hobby” for the participants, so the manager will definitely pay attention to whether you have shown interest in previously promoted projects. The above points are a sure way to understand whether you will be useful for promoting a particular project or service.[2]: Your application was rejected for one of the possible reasons: if you have more neg feedback than positive, if there is an active flag, if you have a neutral feedback left by actmyname, or if you have neutral feedback from another DT member who flagged you as a sig spammer, if you are abusing posting in mega threads. Also, how evenly distributed your posts are in relation to the number of threads in which these posts were written. Depending on how many users from your local section have applied and how often you move from one campaign to another, etc.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: The Avatar is very nice. It is one of the best Avatar I have seen.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP, congratulations on your new campaign. Nice graphics you got for your campaign but I noticed something about the Links above more especially the discussion thread when you click it, it does not take directly to the discussion thread and it seems the link is broken or was not properly attached. I will suggest you look into it. Thanks you.Once again congratulations.

comments.author: big_daddy
comments.body: Username: big_daddyBTC SegWit Address: 3Gm84W1rc5ysyR5fvM35b94kojkgymKFmP-- will update my avatar and signature if accepted --btw, great avatar design

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: icopress on April 12, 2023, 10:33:53 PMAgoraDesk is also committed to maintaining simplicity and privacy, so it never requests KYC/AML and never plans to do so.When I found this thread, this was the only thing I was looking for, and that's a good start. There is no KYC and no plan to implement it, so let's move on. There is a need to just use more of platform that doesn't require KYC to trade bitcoin.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: icopress on April 12, 2023, 10:33:53 PMAgoraDesk is also committed to maintaining simplicity and privacy, so it never requests KYC/AML and never plans to do so.This particularly has the ability to attract many users on to the platform. Many people want to maintain their anonymity and did not want any sort of KYC verification, this statement about never having the intention to demand for KYC will put joy in people's hearts and draw them to the platform, nice one.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: Will there be any avatar only slots?
